questions.explanation:
Shadow.

	In the second episode of the first season, Harm and his new partner Meg Austin board a submarine taken over by a software developer. Meg defeats her claustrophobia and also the software developer who took over the submarine.

Rendezvous.

	In the season finale of the second season, Harm and Mac are on opposing sides as they battle over the death of a man that may have been caused by a woman's abusive husband. Also, Harm finds out about Mac's past and Harriet and Bud's relationship begins to grow stronger.

The Stalker.

	In this third season episode, Mac's ex-boyfriend Dalton Lowne is killed by Detective Frank Coster, Mac's stalker, who Mac met in "King of Fleas". Meanwhile, Harm literally runs into the Admiral's daughter and Mac and the Admiral almost kiss at a party. This episode won a Prism award for depicting Mac's alcoholism.

Innocence.

	In this fourth season episode, the Admiral is informed of an assault in Japan by a Navy Ensign during a "JAG" baseball game. Harm and Mac are sent to Japan to defend the Ensign who says he didn't assault the Japanese woman. When problems arise in the case, Harm and Mac have to depend on a Japanese lawyer to help the Ensign win his case.

Boomerang.

	Boomerang is the fifth two part episode for "JAG". When the American "JAG" corp is called to Australia, Harm, Mac, and Bud come face to face with Mic causing a fight, a broken jaw, and a marriage proposal. "Boomerang" marks "JAG"'s one-hundredth episode.

Miracles.

	Gerald McRaney makes his first guest appearance in this sixth season episode as a Sergeant Major accused of trying to kill his wife. He claims that a dead chaplain led him to his injured wife. Meanwhile, Tiner uses the Admiral's computer to locate aliens.

Enemy Below.

	This shocking seventh season finale ends the reign of terror caused by Kabir Atef when Harm, in an F-14 leads a nuclear missile into the ocean. Meanwhile in Afghanistan, Bud is injured by a land mine after visiting the site where a new school building was going to be built.

Pas De Deux.

	"Pas De Deux" is the second episode in a trilogy of final episodes for season eight. The episode continues the storyline of Clayton Webb and Mac undercover as married diamond experts. Back in Washington, Bud marries Harm and Catherine Gale. Randy Vasquez returns as Gunny Victor Galindez. The episode title is translated as dance for two.

Hail and Farewell.

	In the ninth season finale, Mac must break the news to Harm about Clay's death as well as her reason why she may never have children. Meanwhile, Bud and Harriet break news of their own to everyone when they announce that they are pregnant with twins.

There Goes The Neighborhood.

	In this tenth and final season episode, Jennifer is interrogated for the murder of a man she once knew and Harm helps her find her best friend who Jennifer knows committed the murder. With Bud's help, a woman escapes punishment for giving her dying father some flying lessons in an F-18.
